Original: I have received word from explorers
who ventured out to see the unusual
situation at Yggdrasil.
[Page]
The brittle, withered husk of the
tree has snapped from the midsection
up, revealing a hole within.
[Page]
It seems possible to enter the shaft
with a skyship. A troop of Tharsis
soldiers are currently investigating.
[Page]
I would like for you to meet up with
this troop to get the details of the
situation before heading deeper.
[Page]
You have two goals: first, securing
the Medium, and second, preventing
Yggdrasil's power from awakening.
[Page]
From all you've told me, it doesn't
sound as if you'll be able to avoid
engaging the Imperial Prince.
[Page]
I leave the decision to you when you
come to it, though I will bear the
ultimate responsibility. Good luck.
Translation: I have received word from explorers
who ventured out to see the unusual
situation at Yggdrasil.
[Page]
The brittle, withered husk of the
tree has snapped from the midsection
up, revealing a hole within.
[Page]
It seems possible to enter the shaft
with a skyship. A troop of Tharsis
soldiers are currently investigating.
[Page]
I would like for you to meet up with
this troop to get the details of the
situation before heading deeper.
[Page]
You have two goals: first, securing
the Medium, and second, preventing
Yggdrasil's power from awakening.
[Page]
From all you've told me, it doesn't
sound as if you'll be able to avoid
engaging the Imperial Prince.
[Page]
I leave the decision to you when you
come to it, though I will bear the
ultimate responsibility. Good luck.

Original: Hm... So you challenged the Titan
before it could fully awaken and
rescued the Medium from its core?
[Page]
It sounds like the path to success
was difficult, but you have followed
it to a splendid result. Thank you.
[Page]
To show our appreciation for your
strength and courage, I present you
this on behalf of the city.
Translation: Hm... So you challenged the Titan
before it could fully awaken and
rescued the Medium from its core?
[Page]
It sounds like the path to success
was difficult, but you have followed
it to a splendid result. Thank you.
[Page]
To show our appreciation for your
strength and courage, I present you
this on behalf of the city.

Original: The way you reached out not only to
the Medium, but to the Imperial Prince
as well, is to be commended.
[Page]
Though the Medium has cured him, his
illness took quite a toll. He is
resting now in a Tharsis hospital.
[Page]
I am curious, where is the Medium
now? Ah... so you have returned her
to Vessel Town.
[Page]
She hasn't been back to her home in
some time, has she? I hope she is
recuperating from her ordeal there.
[Page]
I wager she'd like it if you visited
her sometime. I was planning on
visiting all the settlements, myself.
[Page]
The issue du jour is how Tharsis, the
Empire, the Vessels, and the Sentinels
can coexist going forward.
[Page]
I have reached out to the Empire to
relocate the scattered Imperial citizens
to Tharsis.
[Page]
What say you? Will you continue
lending us your strength to bring
our peoples together?
Translation: The way you reached out not only to
the Medium, but to the Imperial Prince
as well, is to be commended.
[Page]
Though the Medium has cured him, his
illness took quite a toll. He is
resting now in a Tharsis hospital.
[Page]
I am curious, where is the Medium
now? Ah... so you have returned her
to Vessel Town.
[Page]
She hasn't been back to her home in
some time, has she? I hope she is
recuperating from her ordeal there.
[Page]
I wager she'd like it if you visited
her sometime. I was planning on
visiting all the settlements, myself.
[Page]
The issue du jour is how Tharsis, the
Empire, the Vessels, and the Sentinels
can coexist going forward.
[Page]
I have reached out to the Empire to
relocate the scattered Imperial citizens
to Tharsis.
[Page]
What say you? Will you continue
lending us your strength to bring
our peoples together?

Original: [Color:5]How will you respond?[Color:0]
Pledge your support
Say you can't make promises
Remain silent
Translation: [Color:5]How will you respond?[Color:0]
Pledge your support
Say you can't make promises
Remain silent

Original: I do appreciate it. But favors to me
aside, you explorers are by nature
men and women of the world.
[Page]
You needn't feel bound to the answer
you just gave. But you are free to
remain in Tharsis as long as you like.
[Page]
There are still many secrets in these
skies to be teased out. I daresay
you won't want for adventure!
[Page]
For example, have you heard of the
[Color:5]Golden Deer Keep[Color:0] in the northwest of
the Cloudy Stronghold?
[Page]
There is a door there that we couldn't
open, but then a surrendering Imperial
officer turned out to have the key.
[Page]
Supposedly the labyrinth contained
some check on Yggdrasil's power...
The details are unknown.
[Page]
I've had the door opened. If it
interests you, why not explore inside?
It would at least help fill your book.
[Page]
Come to that, [Color:5]I'd like to see that
logbook[Color:0] of yours once all the pages
are full. It seems fascinating...
Translation: I do appreciate it. But favors to me
aside, you explorers are by nature
men and women of the world.
[Page]
You needn't feel bound to the answer
you just gave. But you are free to
remain in Tharsis as long as you like.
[Page]
There are still many secrets in these
skies to be teased out. I daresay
you won't want for adventure!
[Page]
For example, have you heard of the
[Color:5]Golden Deer Keep[Color:0] in the northwest of
the Cloudy Stronghold?
[Page]
There is a door there that we couldn't
open, but then a surrendering Imperial
officer turned out to have the key.
[Page]
Supposedly the labyrinth contained
some check on Yggdrasil's power...
The details are unknown.
[Page]
I've had the door opened. If it
interests you, why not explore inside?
It would at least help fill your book.
[Page]
Come to that, [Color:5]I'd like to see that
logbook[Color:0] of yours once all the pages
are full. It seems fascinating...

Original: Oh, I understand. You explorers are
by nature men and women of the world.
I cannot keep you cooped up here.
[Page]
But if you should ever think it worth
your time to help us... well, I for
one would not turn you down!
[Page]
There are still many secrets in these
skies to be teased out. I daresay
you won't want for adventure!
[Page]
For example, have you heard of the
[Color:5]Golden Deer Keep[Color:0] in the northwest of
the Cloudy Stronghold?
[Page]
There is a door there that we couldn't
open, but then a surrendering Imperial
officer turned out to have the key.
[Page]

some check on Yggdrasil's power...

It would at least help fill your book.

logbook[Color:0] of yours once all the pages
are full. It seems fascinating...

I cannot keep you cooped up here.
[Page]

your time to help us... well, I for
one would not turn you down!
[Page]

[Page]

[Page]

some check on Yggdrasil's power...
The details are unknown.
[Page]
I've had the door opened. If it
interests you, why not explore inside?
It would at least help fill your book.
[Page]
Come to that, [Color:5]I'd like to see that
logbook[Color:0] of yours once all the pages
are full. It seems fascinating...

Original: Hrm... forgive me for the bold
request! Perhaps I overstepped my
bounds in asking.
[Page]
You explorers are by nature men and
women of the world, who bridle at
being tied down... Isn't that so?
[Page]
There's no need to promise me
anything! You are free to remain in
Tharsis for as long as you like.
[Page]
There are still many secrets in these
skies to be teased out. I daresay
you won't want for adventure!
[Page]
For example, have you heard of the
[Color:5]Golden Deer Keep[Color:0] in the northwest of
the Cloudy Stronghold?
[Page]
There is a door there that we couldn't
open, but then a surrendering Imperial
officer turned out to have the key.

some check on Yggdrasil's power...
The details are unknown.
[Page]

interests you, why not explore inside?
It would at least help fill your book.
[Page]
Come to that, [Color:5]I'd like to see that
logbook[Color:0] of yours once all the pages
are full. It seems fascinating...
Translation: Hrm... forgive me for the bold
request! Perhaps I overstepped my
bounds in asking.
[Page]

women of the world, who bridle at
being tied down... Isn't that so?
[Page]

anything! You are free to remain in
Tharsis for as long as you like.
[Page]

skies to be teased out. I daresay
you won't want for adventure!
[Page]

[Color:5]Golden Deer Keep[Color:0] in the northwest of

[Page]

officer turned out to have the key.
[Page]

some check on Yggdrasil's power...
The details are unknown.
[Page]
I've had the door opened. If it
interests you, why not explore inside?
It would at least help fill your book.
[Page]
Come to that, [Color:5]I'd like to see that
logbook[Color:0] of yours once all the pages
are full. It seems fascinating...

Original: You descend into the shaft and step
into the ancient ruins in the depths
of Yggdrasil.
[Page]
Ahead of you is a giant stone door.
A number of armored soldiers are
inspecting the door's construction.
[Page]
Of these, a number of them wear
gleaming black armor that marks them
as Imperial, not Tharsis, troops.
Translation: You descend into the shaft and step
into the ancient ruins in the depths
of Yggdrasil.
[Page]
Ahead of you is a giant stone door.
A number of armored soldiers are
inspecting the door's construction.
[Page]
Of these, a number of them wear
gleaming black armor that marks them
as Imperial, not Tharsis, troops.

Original: "You must be the [Guild] Guild.
I'm an Imperial soldier who came to
Tharsis with Sir Logre."
[Page]
The man gazes at the door, frustrated.
"Sorry to say, but this door is sealed
tight. We can't get it open.
[Page]
"We checked the records left in the
rooms nearby, and it seems the real
power is past here, in the core."
Translation: "You must be the [Guild] Guild.
I'm an Imperial soldier who came to
Tharsis with Sir Logre."
[Page]
The man gazes at the door, frustrated.
"Sorry to say, but this door is sealed
tight. We can't get it open.
[Page]
"We checked the records left in the
rooms nearby, and it seems the real
power is past here, in the core."

Original: "This door is called the [Color:5]King's Gate[Color:0].
To open it, you need the [Color:5]credentials
of the four kings[Color:0] who made the seal.
[Page]
"We also found that west of here are
the castles where the kings ruled,
with each one containing a throne...
[Page]
"But we don't know who those four
kings were," says the Tharsis soldier
as he shakes his head.
Translation: "This door is called the [Color:5]King's Gate[Color:0].
To open it, you need the [Color:5]credentials
of the four kings[Color:0] who made the seal.
[Page]
"We also found that west of here are
the castles where the kings ruled,
with each one containing a throne...
[Page]
"But we don't know who those four
kings were," says the Tharsis soldier
as he shakes his head.

Original: "His Imperial Highness will already
be past this point. He's not one to
let an obstacle like this stop him."
[Page]
You recognize the voice as belonging
to the Imperial knight Logre, who
walks into the room with you.
[Page]
"Forgive me, but doing nothing wasn't
sitting well with me. I took it upon
myself to come and help investigate.
[Page]
"I'll look around a little more. You
should go through the maze and try to
identify the kings and castles."
Translation: "His Imperial Highness will already
be past this point. He's not one to
let an obstacle like this stop him."
[Page]
You recognize the voice as belonging
to the Imperial knight Logre, who
walks into the room with you.
[Page]
"Forgive me, but doing nothing wasn't
sitting well with me. I took it upon
myself to come and help investigate.
[Page]
"I'll look around a little more. You
should go through the maze and try to
identify the kings and castles."

Original: "Hmm... His Imperial Highness will
already be inside. He's not one to
let an obstacle like this stop him.
[Page]
"Thank you, men, that was helpful."
[Page]
Logre pats their leader on the
shoulder and compliments them on
their find.
[Page]
"Now... we're short on time. Let's
head west. Maybe there, we can find
out what the kings and castles are."
Translation: "Hmm... His Imperial Highness will
already be inside. He's not one to
let an obstacle like this stop him.
[Page]
"Thank you, men, that was helpful."
[Page]
Logre pats their leader on the
shoulder and compliments them on
their find.
[Page]
"Now... we're short on time. Let's
head west. Maybe there, we can find
out what the kings and castles are."

Original: "Hmm... His Imperial Highness will
already be inside. He's not one to
let an obstacle like this stop him.
[Page]
"Thank you, men, that was helpful."
[Page]
Logre speaks up, patting their leader
on the shoulder and complimenting
them on their find.
[Page]
"Now... we're short on time. I'm
going west. Maybe there, I can find
out what the kings and castles are."
Translation: "Hmm... His Imperial Highness will
already be inside. He's not one to
let an obstacle like this stop him.
[Page]
"Thank you, men, that was helpful."
[Page]
Logre speaks up, patting their leader
on the shoulder and complimenting
them on their find.
[Page]
"Now... we're short on time. I'm
going west. Maybe there, I can find
out what the kings and castles are."

Original: Down the long corridor is a familiar
sight...
[Page]
You blink, but there is no mistaking
it. You recognize this labyrinth
patrolled by mechanical automatons...
[Page]
You find yourself in the Echoing
Library, which must be connected to
the Forgotten Capital underground!
[Page]
Could there be a king somewhere in
this labyrinth that would open the
King's Gate? You resume your search...
Translation: Down the long corridor is a familiar
sight...
[Page]
You blink, but there is no mistaking
it. You recognize this labyrinth
patrolled by mechanical automatons...
[Page]
You find yourself in the Echoing
Library, which must be connected to
the Forgotten Capital underground!
[Page]
Could there be a king somewhere in
this labyrinth that would open the
King's Gate? You resume your search...

Original: Down the long corridor is a familiar
sight.
[Page]
These hard rock surfaces that can show
heated or frigid faces depending on
the scorching hot scales...
[Page]
You find yourself in the Golden Lair,
which is evidently connected to the
Echoing Library underground.
[Page]
You must find the king's throne
somewhere in this labyrinth.
You resume your search...
Translation: Down the long corridor is a familiar
sight.
[Page]
These hard rock surfaces that can show
heated or frigid faces depending on
the scorching hot scales...
[Page]
You find yourself in the Golden Lair,
which is evidently connected to the
Echoing Library underground.
[Page]
You must find the king's throne
somewhere in this labyrinth.
You resume your search...

Original: Down the long corridor is a familiar
sight.
[Page]
A forest choked with thick fog that
limits visibility. You remember how
easy it is to lose your way here...
[Page]
You find yourself in the Misty Ravine.
It is becoming evident that the four
labyrinths are connected underground.
[Page]
You would not be surprised now to find
that the Lush Woodlands were also
connected. You resume your search...
Translation: Down the long corridor is a familiar
sight.
[Page]
A forest choked with thick fog that
limits visibility. You remember how
easy it is to lose your way here...
[Page]
You find yourself in the Misty Ravine.
It is becoming evident that the four
labyrinths are connected underground.
[Page]
You would not be surprised now to find
that the Lush Woodlands were also
connected. You resume your search...

Original: Down the long corridor is a familiar
sight.
[Page]
That dry forest where you fought for
your lives against the red-furred
beast in your novice days...
[Page]
You are in the Lush Woodlands. All the
labyrinths have been confirmed to
connect to Yggdrasil!
[Page]
That is one mystery solved, but the
end of your journey is not yet within
reach. You resume your search...
Translation: Down the long corridor is a familiar
sight.
[Page]
That dry forest where you fought for
your lives against the red-furred
beast in your novice days...
[Page]
You are in the Lush Woodlands. All the
labyrinths have been confirmed to
connect to Yggdrasil!
[Page]
That is one mystery solved, but the
end of your journey is not yet within
reach. You resume your search...

Original: Before you is a giant altar with a
strange crest engraved in it.
[Page]
You recognize this crest... it was
also inscribed in the stone monuments
near the ravines connecting the lands.
[Page]
Could this be the king's throne...?
Translation: Before you is a giant altar with a
strange crest engraved in it.
[Page]
You recognize this crest... it was
also inscribed in the stone monuments
near the ravines connecting the lands.
[Page]
Could this be the king's throne...?

Original: [Color:5]Check the altar?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Check the altar?[Color:0]

Original: When you raise your hand to touch it,
the crest shines and an unearthly
sound echoes from somewhere.
[Page]
It sounds like a vast mesh of gears
spinning. Eventually, the noise comes
to a halt.
[Page]
Nothing nearby seems to have changed,
but the mechanism may have affected
something somewhere else.
Translation: When you raise your hand to touch it,
the crest shines and an unearthly
sound echoes from somewhere.
[Page]
It sounds like a vast mesh of gears
spinning. Eventually, the noise comes
to a halt.
[Page]
Nothing nearby seems to have changed,
but the mechanism may have affected
something somewhere else.

Original: "How are things here? I see... It's
good that you're all safe," says
Logre, greeting the Imperial soldiers.
[Page]
"That giant bell filled me with dread.
And I see it's just as I thought...
[Page]
"The emblems on the gates are glowing
now. I think it safe to assume we
have gained the kings' credentials."
[Page]
Logre smiles at the Imperial soldiers,
but there is nothing joyous in his
expression.
[Page]
At any rate, the stone gates will no
longer bar Logre's passage. A new leg
of his journey awaits him...
[Page]
"Well then, it's time I went ahead."
Logre takes a deep breath. "To stop
His Imperial Highness..."
Translation: "How are things here? I see... It's
good that you're all safe," says
Logre, greeting the Imperial soldiers.
[Page]
"That giant bell filled me with dread.
And I see it's just as I thought...
[Page]
"The emblems on the gates are glowing
now. I think it safe to assume we
have gained the kings' credentials."
[Page]
Logre smiles at the Imperial soldiers,
but there is nothing joyous in his
expression.
[Page]
At any rate, the stone gates will no
longer bar Logre's passage. A new leg
of his journey awaits him...
[Page]
"Well then, it's time I went ahead."
Logre takes a deep breath. "To stop
His Imperial Highness..."

Original: Logre nods to the Imperial soldiers
and looks quietly up at the portal.
[Page]
The Imperial soldiers give a crisp
salute to see Logre off as he proceeds
through the gates...
Translation: Logre nods to the Imperial soldiers
and looks quietly up at the portal.
[Page]
The Imperial soldiers give a crisp
salute to see Logre off as he proceeds
through the gates...

[Page]

[Page]

[Page]

sound echoes from somewhere.

[Page]

Original: Just as you are wondering about that,
the sound of an enormous bell shakes
the entire labyrinth.
[Page]
You grow anxious to hear its ringing.
It is as if it tolls a warning that
something dangerous is afoot.
[Page]
Eventually, the dolorous tone stops.
You have activated all four of the
kings' emblems now...
[Page]
If this means gaining the necessary
credentials, then these credentials
you have certainly won.
[Page]
You wonder if you should return now to
the Forgotten Capital to see if there
has been a change in the King's Gate.
Translation: Just as you are wondering about that,
the sound of an enormous bell shakes
the entire labyrinth.
[Page]
You grow anxious to hear its ringing.
It is as if it tolls a warning that
something dangerous is afoot.
[Page]
Eventually, the dolorous tone stops.
You have activated all four of the
kings' emblems now...
[Page]
If this means gaining the necessary
credentials, then these credentials
you have certainly won.
[Page]
You wonder if you should return now to
the Forgotten Capital to see if there
has been a change in the King's Gate.

Original: You revisit the King's Gate. The troop
of soldiers you left here are talking
amongst themselves with excitement.
[Page]
You approach them...
Translation: You revisit the King's Gate. The troop
of soldiers you left here are talking
amongst themselves with excitement.
[Page]
You approach them...

Original: "Ah, you're back. I'm glad to see you
returned safely." Logre is here in
front of the gates waiting for you.
[Page]
He is looking up at that giant portal
alongside the other Imperial soldiers.
[Page]
"That giant bell filled me with dread,
so I returned here... and lo and
behold, it's just as I thought.
[Page]
"As you can see, the emblems on the
gates are glowing now. I assume you
gained the kings' credentials."
[Page]
Logre smiles darkly at you.
[Page]
At any rate, the stone gates will no
longer bar your passage. A new leg of
your journey awaits you...
[Page]
"This is where I must leave things to
you, including His Imperial Highness.
He has come too far to stop himself."
Translation: "Ah, you're back. I'm glad to see you
returned safely." Logre is here in
front of the gates waiting for you.
[Page]
He is looking up at that giant portal
alongside the other Imperial soldiers.
[Page]
"That giant bell filled me with dread,
so I returned here... and lo and
behold, it's just as I thought.
[Page]
"As you can see, the emblems on the
gates are glowing now. I assume you
gained the kings' credentials."
[Page]
Logre smiles darkly at you.
[Page]
At any rate, the stone gates will no
longer bar your passage. A new leg of
your journey awaits you...
[Page]
"This is where I must leave things to
you, including His Imperial Highness.
He has come too far to stop himself."

Original: After nodding to Logre, you face the
sizable door.
[Page]
The Imperial soldiers give a crisp
salute to see you off as you proceed
through the gates...
Translation: After nodding to Logre, you face the
sizable door.
[Page]
The Imperial soldiers give a crisp
salute to see you off as you proceed
through the gates...

Original: "How are things here? I see... It's
good that you're all safe," says
Logre, greeting the Imperial soldiers.
[Page]
"That giant bell filled me with dread.
And I see it's just as I thought...
[Page]
"The emblems on the gates are glowing
now. I think it safe to assume we
have gained the kings' credentials."
[Page]
Logre smiles to you, but there is
nothing joyous in his expression.
[Page]
At any rate, the stone gates will no
longer bar your passage. A new leg of
your journey awaits you...
[Page]
"The real mission starts here. Come
on, everyone, let's go."
Translation: "How are things here? I see... It's
good that you're all safe," says
Logre, greeting the Imperial soldiers.
[Page]
"That giant bell filled me with dread.
And I see it's just as I thought...
[Page]
"The emblems on the gates are glowing
now. I think it safe to assume we
have gained the kings' credentials."
[Page]
Logre smiles to you, but there is
nothing joyous in his expression.
[Page]
At any rate, the stone gates will no
longer bar your passage. A new leg of
your journey awaits you...
[Page]
"The real mission starts here. Come
on, everyone, let's go."

Original: Logre finishes speaking as he gazes
into the distance, and then looks
silently up at the portal.
[Page]
The Imperial soldiers give a crisp
salute to see you off as you proceed
through the gates...
Translation: Logre finishes speaking as he gazes
into the distance, and then looks
silently up at the portal.
[Page]
The Imperial soldiers give a crisp
salute to see you off as you proceed
through the gates...

Original: The stone gates engraved with the
five emblems are tightly sealed.
Translation: The stone gates engraved with the
five emblems are tightly sealed.

Original: At the end of a wide corridor, you
come across a door.
[Page]
You can hear strong winds howling from
the other side at regular intervals,
like some titanic creature's breath...
[Page]
The source of the stifling smell of
vegetation that permeates this hall
also seems to be beyond the door.
[Page]
What could possibly await you ahead?
Translation: At the end of a wide corridor, you
come across a door.
[Page]
You can hear strong winds howling from
the other side at regular intervals,
like some titanic creature's breath...
[Page]
The source of the stifling smell of
vegetation that permeates this hall
also seems to be beyond the door.
[Page]
What could possibly await you ahead?

Original: You open the door and venture through
into a giant corridor that stretches
north to south.
[Page]
You are surprised by a stifling smell
of vegetation in the air...
[Page]
Particularly since no matter where you
look, you do not see anything that
would emit such a scent.
[Page]
You brace yourselves for anything and
resume searching the maze...
Translation: You open the door and venture through
into a giant corridor that stretches
north to south.
[Page]
You are surprised by a stifling smell
of vegetation in the air...
[Page]
Particularly since no matter where you
look, you do not see anything that
would emit such a scent.
[Page]
You brace yourselves for anything and
resume searching the maze...

Original: Inside the room is a giant, terrifying
face.
[Page]
At first glance, it seems to be an
inert carving, but on close inspection
you see that it is pulsing slightly.
[Page]
It is breathing... the titanic face
before you apparently belongs to a
living being!
Translation: Inside the room is a giant, terrifying
face.
[Page]
At first glance, it seems to be an
inert carving, but on close inspection
you see that it is pulsing slightly.
[Page]
It is breathing... the titanic face
before you apparently belongs to a
living being!

Original: In the room's center, the Imperial
Prince is on his knees. The Medium is
nowhere to be seen.
[Page]
Sensing your arrival, the Imperial
Prince turns. His once-clear eyes are
dull and his breathing is ragged...
[Page]
He is obviously not his usual self.
However, he musters what little
strength he has to draw himself up.
Translation: In the room's center, the Imperial
Prince is on his knees. The Medium is
nowhere to be seen.
[Page]
Sensing your arrival, the Imperial
Prince turns. His once-clear eyes are
dull and his breathing is ragged...
[Page]
He is obviously not his usual self.
However, he musters what little
strength he has to draw himself up.

Original: "In times past... the land was so
tainted by man's hand that not even
the plants of the field would grow.
[Page]
"People dreamed of a purified land...
A return to paradise. Thus was
Yggdrasil... this Titan... created.
[Page]
"Yggdrasil and the Titan are one and
the same. The slumbering Titan became
a giant tree to conserve its power.
[Page]
"What we once thought to be our hope
has largely been lost.
[Page]
"Those who could not control Her,
feared Her, and tried to bury Her...
But my Empire will reawaken Her.
[Page]
"See! With these hands, the heart of
its power and the Medium who is Her
soul are made one with Yggdrasil!
[Page]
"The Medium shall convey the sacred
word of the crown's bearer. Witness
the revival of the [Color:5][Enemy1:179][Color:0]!"
Translation: "In times past... the land was so
tainted by man's hand that not even
the plants of the field would grow.
[Page]
"People dreamed of a purified land...
A return to paradise. Thus was
Yggdrasil... this Titan... created.
[Page]
"Yggdrasil and the Titan are one and
the same. The slumbering Titan became
a giant tree to conserve its power.
[Page]
"What we once thought to be our hope
has largely been lost.
[Page]
"Those who could not control Her,
feared Her, and tried to bury Her...
But my Empire will reawaken Her.
[Page]
"See! With these hands, the heart of
its power and the Medium who is Her
soul are made one with Yggdrasil!
[Page]
"The Medium shall convey the sacred
word of the crown's bearer. Witness
the revival of the [Color:5][Enemy1:179][Color:0]!"

Original: The Imperial Prince raises his drive
blade and the Titan's body shakes in
response.
[Page]
Greenish miasma pours from the nearby
walls... The Titan lives!
[Page]
The Titan raises an arm, shattering
the ceiling, and slowly crawls up
towards the surface.
Translation: The Imperial Prince raises his drive
blade and the Titan's body shakes in
response.
[Page]
Greenish miasma pours from the nearby
walls... The Titan lives!
[Page]
The Titan raises an arm, shattering
the ceiling, and slowly crawls up
towards the surface.

Original: "Her revival was my father's most
fervent wish... Her hope spurred on
the knights who lost their lives.
[Page]
"I must compensate for their losses
and protect the families they left
behind! The future they believed in!
[Page]
"I won't stand for your meddling
'salvation'! All who oppose the Empire
will fall before my family blade!"
Translation: "Her revival was my father's most
fervent wish... Her hope spurred on
the knights who lost their lives.
[Page]
"I must compensate for their losses
and protect the families they left
behind! The future they believed in!
[Page]
"I won't stand for your meddling
'salvation'! All who oppose the Empire
will fall before my family blade!"

Original: As the Imperial Prince points his
clockwork sword at you, green miasma
pours out from chinks in his armor!
[Page]
Vines follow the miasma outward,
piercing his skin and encasing his
flesh...
[Page]
The former Imperial Prince, now a
monster wrapped in Yggdrasil's
miasma, roars and charges at you!
Translation: As the Imperial Prince points his
clockwork sword at you, green miasma
pours out from chinks in his armor!
[Page]
Vines follow the miasma outward,
piercing his skin and encasing his
flesh...
[Page]
The former Imperial Prince, now a
monster wrapped in Yggdrasil's
miasma, roars and charges at you!

Original: With your final strike, the circlet he
wears as a headpiece shatters and the
drive blade falls from his hand.
[Page]
Though blood streams from wounds on
his head, he still attempts to stand.
Suddenly, the labyrinth quakes.
[Page]
Cracks race across the ground from
the impact of the Titan's footfalls;
one reaches toward the Prince's feet!
[Page]
Before you can begin to react, the
wounded Imperial Prince loses his
balance and falls into the abyss.
Translation: With your final strike, the circlet he
wears as a headpiece shatters and the
drive blade falls from his hand.
[Page]
Though blood streams from wounds on
his head, he still attempts to stand.
Suddenly, the labyrinth quakes.
[Page]
Cracks race across the ground from
the impact of the Titan's footfalls;
one reaches toward the Prince's feet!
[Page]
Before you can begin to react, the
wounded Imperial Prince loses his
balance and falls into the abyss.

Original: "URRRAAAAAAAHHHHH!"
Translation: "URRRAAAAAAAHHHHH!"

Original: The Titan howls, as if lamenting the
loss of the Imperial Prince, but it
does not slow its ascent.
[Page]
The quake shows no sign of ending...
The sound of cracking walls and
ceilings echoes all around...
Translation: The Titan howls, as if lamenting the
loss of the Imperial Prince, but it
does not slow its ascent.
[Page]
The quake shows no sign of ending...
The sound of cracking walls and
ceilings echoes all around...

Original: The door will not open. It seems that
the ceilings and walls have collapsed,
blocking the door from the other side.
Translation: The door will not open. It seems that
the ceilings and walls have collapsed,
blocking the door from the other side.

Original: As soon as you step back into the
open air of the Cloudy Stronghold, a
bloodcurdling roar shakes the skies.
Translation: As soon as you step back into the
open air of the Cloudy Stronghold, a
bloodcurdling roar shakes the skies.

Original: Released from its bonds, the Titan
shows its godlike, yet dreadful form
to the world.
[Page]
It is not difficult to imagine a city
the size of Tharsis being crushed
beneath its heel as it passes...
[Page]
You stare at the Titan with abject
despair... when suddenly, a small
flicker of light silently appears.
[Page]
It is the firefly-like light that has
guided you to the Medium from time
to time.
[Page]
The light slowly drifts north before
disappearing, as if pointing you
toward the Titan.
Translation: Released from its bonds, the Titan
shows its godlike, yet dreadful form
to the world.
[Page]
It is not difficult to imagine a city
the size of Tharsis being crushed
beneath its heel as it passes...
[Page]
You stare at the Titan with abject
despair... when suddenly, a small
flicker of light silently appears.
[Page]
It is the firefly-like light that has
guided you to the Medium from time
to time.
[Page]
The light slowly drifts north before
disappearing, as if pointing you
toward the Titan.

Original: The [Skyship] closes in on the giant.
You do not feel any symptoms of the
Titan's Curse thus far...
[Page]
The Titan gives a low rumble and looks
at you with great curiosity as you
flit around it.
[Page]
But just as you are about to approach
its face, the Titan swings its fist down,
nearly smashing the [Skyship]!
[Page]
If you sail any closer, a fight will
become unavoidable. Are you prepared
to do battle with the malevolent god?
Translation: The [Skyship] closes in on the giant.
You do not feel any symptoms of the
Titan's Curse thus far...
[Page]
The Titan gives a low rumble and looks
at you with great curiosity as you
flit around it.
[Page]
But just as you are about to approach
its face, the Titan swings its fist down,
nearly smashing the [Skyship]!
[Page]
If you sail any closer, a fight will
become unavoidable. Are you prepared
to do battle with the malevolent god?

Original: [Color:5]Challenge the Titan in combat?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Challenge the Titan in combat?[Color:0]

Original: If you sail any closer, a fight will
become unavoidable. Are you prepared
to do battle with the malevolent god?
Translation: If you sail any closer, a fight will
become unavoidable. Are you prepared
to do battle with the malevolent god?

Original: One night has passed since the battle
against the Titan for the fate of all
who live in these lands.
[Page]
You survived the intense struggle...
The Titan that came from the depths of
Yggdrasil fell before your power.
[Page]
On losing its heart and soul, the
Titan's body again metamorphosed
into a new Yggdrasil.
[Page]
In the process, the Titan mustered
the last of its strength to return
the Medium to the human world.
[Page]
You have not yet filed your report
with the Count... Once you have sorted
things out, visit the Grand Court.
Translation: One night has passed since the battle
against the Titan for the fate of all
who live in these lands.
[Page]
You survived the intense struggle...
The Titan that came from the depths of
Yggdrasil fell before your power.
[Page]
On losing its heart and soul, the
Titan's body again metamorphosed
into a new Yggdrasil.
[Page]
In the process, the Titan mustered
the last of its strength to return
the Medium to the human world.
[Page]
You have not yet filed your report
with the Count... Once you have sorted
things out, visit the Grand Court.

Original: "I've been waiting for you, Guild
[Guild]. Well done on making it
back to Tharsis alive!
[Page]
"I placed tremendous expectations on
you and gave you rather a weighty
duty to fulfill.
[Page]
"But you applied yourself to the task
and carried it out splendidly with
nary a complaint! Have you a report?"
Translation: "I've been waiting for you, Guild
[Guild]. Well done on making it
back to Tharsis alive!
[Page]
"I placed tremendous expectations on
you and gave you rather a weighty
duty to fulfill.
[Page]
"But you applied yourself to the task
and carried it out splendidly with
nary a complaint! Have you a report?"

Original: "You're the [Guild] Guild, correct?
The Outland Count is waiting on your
report. Very eagerly, in fact.
[Page]
"I believe he has a reward prepared
for you as well. I recommend not
keeping him waiting."
Translation: "You're the [Guild] Guild, correct?
The Outland Count is waiting on your
report. Very eagerly, in fact.
[Page]
"I believe he has a reward prepared
for you as well. I recommend not
keeping him waiting."

Original: "Good morning, dears. You seemed so
tired yesterday... Did you get a good
night's sleep?
[Page]
"Oh my... You're going straight to
the Grand Court, right? The Outland
Count's been eager to see you.
[Page]
"But there's no hurry! Breakfast is
ready, and I think you should eat up."
Translation: "Good morning, dears. You seemed so
tired yesterday... Did you get a good
night's sleep?
[Page]
"Oh my... You're going straight to
the Grand Court, right? The Outland
Count's been eager to see you.
[Page]
"But there's no hurry! Breakfast is
ready, and I think you should eat up."

Original: When you step into the city square,
you notice an uproar beginning to
form in the corner.
Translation: When you step into the city square,
you notice an uproar beginning to
form in the corner.

Original: "First the Medium, then Yggdrasil...
Is this city of Tharsis your next
target, then?
[Page]
"How can you prove you're not just
another spy? We can't trust the
humans of the Empire!"
[Page]
A group of Vessels you have sometimes
seen around Tharsis has surrounded
an Imperial soldier.
[Page]
The soldier must be one of those who
threw his lot in with Logre as an
ally to Tharsis.
Translation: "First the Medium, then Yggdrasil...
Is this city of Tharsis your next
target, then?
[Page]
"How can you prove you're not just
another spy? We can't trust the
humans of the Empire!"
[Page]
A group of Vessels you have sometimes
seen around Tharsis has surrounded
an Imperial soldier.
[Page]
The soldier must be one of those who
threw his lot in with Logre as an
ally to Tharsis.

Original: The Imperial soldier maintains a stoic
silence. You cannot tell what he may
be feeling under the helm.
[Page]
Seconds later, a Sentinel warrior
intercedes.
Translation: The Imperial soldier maintains a stoic
silence. You cannot tell what he may
be feeling under the helm.
[Page]
Seconds later, a Sentinel warrior
intercedes.

Original: "Enough! I know you are angry over the
Medium's kidnapping, but how will you
help her by attacking this man?
[Page]
"I have seen that some of those from
the Empire wish to right their lord's
wrong, even if they must defy orders.
[Page]
"The Medium reached out to all races
with those small hands. Should not
the Vessels follow her example?"
Translation: "Enough! I know you are angry over the
Medium's kidnapping, but how will you
help her by attacking this man?
[Page]
"I have seen that some of those from
the Empire wish to right their lord's
wrong, even if they must defy orders.
[Page]
"The Medium reached out to all races
with those small hands. Should not
the Vessels follow her example?"

Original: The Vessels do not have an answer for
the Sentinel warrior's challenge. The
Imperial soldier quietly walks away.
[Page]
The new faces in Tharsis are making
it a different city... You doubt this
is the last such dispute you'll see.
Translation: The Vessels do not have an answer for
the Sentinel warrior's challenge. The
Imperial soldier quietly walks away.
[Page]
The new faces in Tharsis are making
it a different city... You doubt this
is the last such dispute you'll see.

Original: In your pursuit of the Imperial Prince
and the Medium, you notice something
on the ground, entangled in vines.
[Page]
As you draw near, a sickening
realization of what it is dawns
upon you!
Translation: In your pursuit of the Imperial Prince
and the Medium, you notice something
on the ground, entangled in vines.
[Page]
As you draw near, a sickening
realization of what it is dawns
upon you!

Original: It is an Imperial soldier infected
with the Titan's Curse, in what looks
to be a gruesomely advanced stage.
[Page]
"Uhh... Ngh..." It seems he has lost
his sight already. He is muttering
deliriously.
Translation: It is an Imperial soldier infected
with the Titan's Curse, in what looks
to be a gruesomely advanced stage.
[Page]
"Uhh... Ngh..." It seems he has lost
his sight already. He is muttering
deliriously.

Original: "What is the matter, [Guild]? Hm?
That man...!"
[Page]
A hulking figure steps between you
and the immobile Imperial soldier.
Translation: "What is the matter, [Guild]? Hm?
That man...!"
[Page]
A hulking figure steps between you
and the immobile Imperial soldier.

Original: It is the leader of the Sentinels'
bushi, Kibagami. He deftly examines
the soldier's condition.
[Page]
It seems Kibagami and a group of his
bushi had been conducting their own
search through this labyrinth.
[Page]
"It seems the Titan's Curse has had
its way with him... We can't leave
him here. I will carry him out.
[Page]
"You must go on ahead. If the Imperial
Prince is further inside, he may be
in an even worse state."
Translation: It is the leader of the Sentinels'
bushi, Kibagami. He deftly examines
the soldier's condition.
[Page]
It seems Kibagami and a group of his
bushi had been conducting their own
search through this labyrinth.
[Page]
"It seems the Titan's Curse has had
its way with him... We can't leave
him here. I will carry him out.
[Page]
"You must go on ahead. If the Imperial
Prince is further inside, he may be
in an even worse state."

Original: You leave the Imperial soldier in
Kibagami's care and hurry onward.
Translation: You leave the Imperial soldier in
Kibagami's care and hurry onward.

Original: "No... open your eyes, soldier of the
Empire!" Kibagami steps between you
and the immobile Imperial soldier.
[Page]
He deftly examines the soldier's
condition.
[Page]
"It seems the Titan's Curse has had
its way with him... We can't leave
him here. But I cannot abandon you..."
Translation: "No... open your eyes, soldier of the
Empire!" Kibagami steps between you
and the immobile Imperial soldier.
[Page]
He deftly examines the soldier's
condition.
[Page]
"It seems the Titan's Curse has had
its way with him... We can't leave
him here. But I cannot abandon you..."

Original: Kibagami furrows his brow and balls
his fists. But a steady, powerful
voice calls out to him.
Translation: Kibagami furrows his brow and balls
his fists. But a steady, powerful
voice calls out to him.

Original: "Leave the man with us, master."
[Page]
A group of Sentinels walks up to you
from behind. It seems they were also
taking part in the search.
[Page]
"We will get this man safely out of
the labyrinth. You must go forward,
master."
Translation: "Leave the man with us, master."
[Page]
A group of Sentinels walks up to you
from behind. It seems they were also
taking part in the search.
[Page]
"We will get this man safely out of
the labyrinth. You must go forward,
master."

Original: The Sentinels skillfully hoist the
Imperial soldier and nod to you before
heading back to the entrance.
[Page]
Kibagami seems proud as he watches
them go. "Those young ones... they've
grown so much."
Translation: The Sentinels skillfully hoist the
Imperial soldier and nod to you before
heading back to the entrance.
[Page]
Kibagami seems proud as he watches
them go. "Those young ones... they've
grown so much."

Original: "Let us hurry ahead, [Guild]. If
the Imperial Prince is further inside,
he may be in an even worse state."
[Page]
You nod your agreement with Kibagami
and look further down the corridor.
Translation: "Let us hurry ahead, [Guild]. If
the Imperial Prince is further inside,
he may be in an even worse state."
[Page]
You nod your agreement with Kibagami
and look further down the corridor.

Original: "No... open your eyes, soldier of the
Empire!" Kibagami rushes to his side
without hesitation.
[Page]
He deftly examines the soldier's
condition.
[Page]
"It seems the Titan's Curse has had
its way with him... We can't leave
him here. But I cannot abandon you..."
Translation: "No... open your eyes, soldier of the
Empire!" Kibagami rushes to his side
without hesitation.
[Page]
He deftly examines the soldier's
condition.
[Page]
"It seems the Titan's Curse has had
its way with him... We can't leave
him here. But I cannot abandon you..."

Original: Kibagami furrows his brow and balls
his fists. But a steady, powerful
voice calls out to him.
Translation: Kibagami furrows his brow and balls
his fists. But a steady, powerful
voice calls out to him.

Original: "Leave the man with us, master."
[Page]
A group of Sentinels walks up to him
from behind. It seems they were also
taking part in the search.
[Page]
"We will get this man safely out of
the labyrinth. You must go forward,
master."
Translation: "Leave the man with us, master."
[Page]
A group of Sentinels walks up to him
from behind. It seems they were also
taking part in the search.
[Page]
"We will get this man safely out of
the labyrinth. You must go forward,
master."

Original: The Sentinels skillfully hoist the
Imperial soldier and nod to you before
heading back to the entrance.
[Page]
Kibagami seems proud as he watches
them go.
Translation: The Sentinels skillfully hoist the
Imperial soldier and nod to you before
heading back to the entrance.
[Page]
Kibagami seems proud as he watches
them go.

Original: "I must hurry ahead. If the Imperial
Prince is further inside, he may be
in an even worse state."
[Page]
With redoubled resolve, Kibagami
turns his attention further down
the corridor.
Translation: "I must hurry ahead. If the Imperial
Prince is further inside, he may be
in an even worse state."
[Page]
With redoubled resolve, Kibagami
turns his attention further down
the corridor.

Original: In your hurried pursuit of the
Imperial Prince and the Medium,
you hear voices up ahead.
Translation: In your hurried pursuit of the
Imperial Prince and the Medium,
you hear voices up ahead.

Original: You nervously approach the voices to
find a Vessel caring for an Imperial
soldier too weak to stand.
[Page]
You know this Vessel... it is Wufan,
leader of the arcanists.
Translation: You nervously approach the voices to
find a Vessel caring for an Imperial
soldier too weak to stand.
[Page]
You know this Vessel... it is Wufan,
leader of the arcanists.

Original: "Oh, it's you. I was trying to find
the Medium, but so far I've only found
this man collapsed on the ground..."
[Page]
There are clusters of vines growing
from the chinks in his armor. It looks
to be late-stage Titan's Curse.
[Page]
His condition seems rather severe,
preventing him from so much as
speaking to you.
[Page]
"The Medium tried to reach out to the
Imperial Prince until the moment she
lost consciousness...
[Page]
"We Vessels live to carry out the
Medium's will. My course is clear.
[Page]
"The anger in my chest has not died
down, but I will not bring it to bear
on them. I swear by the Medium."
[Page]
Wufan looks at you with no hesitation
in her eyes.
[Page]
"Go, Guild [Guild], and leave this
man to me."
Translation: "Oh, it's you. I was trying to find
the Medium, but so far I've only found
this man collapsed on the ground..."
[Page]
There are clusters of vines growing
from the chinks in his armor. It looks
to be late-stage Titan's Curse.
[Page]
His condition seems rather severe,
preventing him from so much as
speaking to you.
[Page]
"The Medium tried to reach out to the
Imperial Prince until the moment she
lost consciousness...
[Page]
"We Vessels live to carry out the
Medium's will. My course is clear.
[Page]
"The anger in my chest has not died
down, but I will not bring it to bear
on them. I swear by the Medium."
[Page]
Wufan looks at you with no hesitation
in her eyes.
[Page]
"Go, Guild [Guild], and leave this
man to me."

Original: You nod to Wufan and proceed down
the corridor.
Translation: You nod to Wufan and proceed down
the corridor.

Original: You nervously approach the voices to
find Vessels caring for an Imperial
soldier too weak to stand.
[Page]
Wufan steps forward and gasps with
surprise.
[Page]
They seem to be the same Vessels who
you saw harassing an Imperial soldier
in the Tharsis city square.
[Page]
The young Vessels appear to have come
across the collapsed Imperial soldier
during their explorations.
[Page]
There are clusters of vines growing
from the chinks in his armor. It looks
to be late-stage Titan's Curse...
[Page]
His condition seems rather severe,
preventing him from so much as
speaking to you...
[Page]
"We wanted to leave him where he laid.
But Wufan... we couldn't."
[Page]
Wufan nods silently at this.
Translation: You nervously approach the voices to
find Vessels caring for an Imperial
soldier too weak to stand.
[Page]
Wufan steps forward and gasps with
surprise.
[Page]

you saw harassing an Imperial soldier
in the Tharsis city square.
[Page]

[Page]

to be late-stage Titan's Curse...
[Page]

preventing him from so much as
speaking to you...
[Page]
"We wanted to leave him where he laid.
But Wufan... we couldn't."
[Page]
Wufan nods silently at this.

Original: "You choose rightly. I am sure that
the Medium would have done the same.
[Page]
"The Medium tried to reach out to the
Imperial Prince until the moment she
lost consciousness...
[Page]
"We Vessels live to carry out the
Medium's will. Our course is clear.
[Page]
"The anger in my chest has not died
down, but I will not bring it to bear
on them. I swear by the Medium."
[Page]
Wufan looks at you with no hesitation
in her eyes.
[Page]
"Let us go. This man is safe in their
care."

the Medium would have done the same.
[Page]

Imperial Prince until the moment she
lost consciousness...
[Page]
"We Vessels live to carry out the

[Page]

[Page]

Wufan speaks to the Vessels with no
hesitation in her eyes.
[Page]
"I leave him in your care. Don't
worry. I will bring the Medium back
safely."

the Medium would have done the same.
[Page]
"The Medium tried to reach out to the
Imperial Prince until the moment she
lost consciousness...
[Page]
"We Vessels live to carry out the
Medium's will. Our course is clear.
[Page]
"The anger in my chest has not died
down, but I will not bring it to bear
on them. I swear by the Medium."
[Page]
Wufan speaks to the Vessels with no
hesitation in her eyes.
[Page]
"I leave him in your care. Don't
worry. I will bring the Medium back
safely."

Original: Wufan nods to her fellow Vessels and
proceeds down the corridor.
Translation: Wufan nods to her fellow Vessels and
proceeds down the corridor.

Original: "It seems your search is going well,
[Guild]."
[Page]
As you leave the inn, the Sentinel
warrior Kibagami hails you.
[Page]
"How strange to think that Yggdrasil
and the Golden Lair were connected.
My people will be very surprised.
[Page]
"One by one, you are getting to the
bottom of these mysteries...
[Page]
"I know you're worried for the Medium,
but don't be. She would be very sad
if something were to happen to you.
[Page]
"Sorry to keep you. But things will
only get harder for you from here
on. Be prepared for that."
Translation: "It seems your search is going well,
[Guild]."
[Page]
As you leave the inn, the Sentinel
warrior Kibagami hails you.
[Page]
"How strange to think that Yggdrasil
and the Golden Lair were connected.
My people will be very surprised.
[Page]
"One by one, you are getting to the
bottom of these mysteries...
[Page]
"I know you're worried for the Medium,
but don't be. She would be very sad
if something were to happen to you.
[Page]
"Sorry to keep you. But things will
only get harder for you from here
on. Be prepared for that."

Original: Kibagami parts with you and walks
into the city crowds.
Translation: Kibagami parts with you and walks
into the city crowds.

Original: As you leave the inn, Kibagami mulls
over recent events.
[Page]
"How strange to think that Yggdrasil
and the Golden Lair were connected.
My people will be very surprised.
[Page]
"One by one, we are getting to the
bottom of these mysteries...
[Page]
"I know you're worried for the Medium,
but don't be. She would be very sad
if something were to happen to us.
[Page]
"Just know that things will only
get harder for us from here on.
Be prepared for that."
Translation: As you leave the inn, Kibagami mulls
over recent events.
[Page]
"How strange to think that Yggdrasil
and the Golden Lair were connected.
My people will be very surprised.
[Page]
"One by one, we are getting to the
bottom of these mysteries...
[Page]
"I know you're worried for the Medium,
but don't be. She would be very sad
if something were to happen to us.
[Page]
"Just know that things will only
get harder for us from here on.
Be prepared for that."

Original: You all nod your assent at Kibagami's
warning and turn your thoughts to
the search that awaits you...
Translation: You all nod your assent at Kibagami's
warning and turn your thoughts to
the search that awaits you...

Original: As Kibagami leaves the inn, he rotates
his shoulders a bit and mutters to
himself.
[Page]
"How strange to think that Yggdrasil
and the Golden Lair were connected.
My people will be very surprised.
[Page]
"One by one, the mysteries are
falling...
[Page]
"Though I worry for the Medium, I must
not panic. If anything went wrong,
I could not show my face to her.
[Page]
"Things will only get harder for from
here on... I must be prepared."
Translation: As Kibagami leaves the inn, he rotates
his shoulders a bit and mutters to
himself.
[Page]
"How strange to think that Yggdrasil
and the Golden Lair were connected.
My people will be very surprised.
[Page]
"One by one, the mysteries are
falling...
[Page]
"Though I worry for the Medium, I must
not panic. If anything went wrong,
I could not show my face to her.
[Page]
"Things will only get harder for from
here on... I must be prepared."

Original: With renewed purpose, Kibagami looks
toward the northern skies.
Translation: With renewed purpose, Kibagami looks
toward the northern skies.

Original: "So, Guild [Guild]... You returned
to the city."
[Page]
You run into Wufan, the Vessel
arcanist, in the city square. She
looks rather pale...
[Page]
"Ha... I haven't slept well. I knew
from the Hollow incident already, but
my own weakness still disgusts me.
[Page]
"I know what causes it. I cannot stop
worrying about the Medium. There is
only so much that I alone can do..."
[Page]
Wufan casts her gaze down and clutches
her staff between slender fingers.
[Page]
"I'm sorry for wasting your time with
this... You're going, no? Try not to
do anything rash."
Translation: "So, Guild [Guild]... You returned
to the city."
[Page]
You run into Wufan, the Vessel
arcanist, in the city square. She
looks rather pale...
[Page]
"Ha... I haven't slept well. I knew
from the Hollow incident already, but
my own weakness still disgusts me.
[Page]
"I know what causes it. I cannot stop
worrying about the Medium. There is
only so much that I alone can do..."
[Page]
Wufan casts her gaze down and clutches
her staff between slender fingers.
[Page]
"I'm sorry for wasting your time with
this... You're going, no? Try not to
do anything rash."

Original: She forces a smile before parting
with you.
Translation: She forces a smile before parting
with you.

Original: When you reach the city square, Wufan
stops briefly, placing a hand on her
forehead.
[Page]
She looks quite pale... You ask if
she is feeling well.
[Page]
"Oh... I haven't slept well. I knew
from the Hollow incident already, but
my own weakness still disgusts me.
[Page]
"I know what causes it. I cannot stop
worrying about the Medium. There is
only so much that I alone can do..."
[Page]
Wufan casts her gaze down and clutches
her staff between slender fingers.
[Page]
"I'm sorry for wasting your time with
this... Shouldn't we be on our way?
Our search isn't over yet."
Translation: When you reach the city square, Wufan
stops briefly, placing a hand on her
forehead.
[Page]
She looks quite pale... You ask if
she is feeling well.
[Page]
"Oh... I haven't slept well. I knew
from the Hollow incident already, but
my own weakness still disgusts me.
[Page]
"I know what causes it. I cannot stop
worrying about the Medium. There is
only so much that I alone can do..."
[Page]
Wufan casts her gaze down and clutches
her staff between slender fingers.
[Page]
"I'm sorry for wasting your time with
this... Shouldn't we be on our way?
Our search isn't over yet."

Original: She forces a smile and begins walking
as if to lead the way.
Translation: She forces a smile and begins walking
as if to lead the way.

Original: When Wufan reaches the city square,
she stops briefly, placing a hand on
her forehead.
[Page]
Her face is extremely pale. A few
passersby notice and ask her
anxiously if she is all right.
[Page]
"Thank you, but... it's nothing.
I haven't slept well lately...
[Page]
"I know what causes it. A young
relative of mine is in danger, and
there is only so much I alone can do."
[Page]
Wufan casts her gaze down and clutches
her staff between slender fingers.
[Page]
"I'm sorry for wasting your time with
this... I'm all right now. Sorry for
the trouble."
Translation: When Wufan reaches the city square,
she stops briefly, placing a hand on
her forehead.
[Page]

anxiously if she is all right.
[Page]

[Page]

there is only so much I alone can do."
[Page]

her staff between slender fingers.
[Page]
"I'm sorry for wasting your time with
this... I'm all right now. Sorry for
the trouble."

Original: She forces a smile and begins walking,
her footsteps unsure.
Translation: She forces a smile and begins walking,
her footsteps unsure.
